summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2019 regarding victim services coordination for the Jeffrey Epstein case. A victim specialist in Miami offers assistance, and a New York-based agent provides an update that no victims have requested services yet, but interviews are scheduled in Florida.

persons.name: M.S.C.J.
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist based at the Miami Headquarters and Homestead Resident Agency, offering to assist with potential victims in the Epstein case.

events.title: Case Agent Travels to Florida
events.description: The Case Agent is reported to be heading to Florida for the investigation.

events.title: Interviews Scheduled in Florida
events.description: Interviews related to the Epstein case are scheduled to take place in Florida.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim services for the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
A Victim Specialist from the Miami FBI office offered assistance to the New York-based team handling the case.
As of July 9, 2019, no victims had yet requested services, but the team was preparing for potential requests.
The Case Agent was traveling to Florida with interviews scheduled, indicating active investigative steps.
The communication highlights inter-office FBI coordination between New York and Florida regarding victim support.
